Package cu.edu.cujae.graphy.core

Interface Node<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - a parametrized type.
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    TreeNode<E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTreeNode, DefaultGeneralTreeNode, DefaultNode
    public interface Node<T>
extends java.lang.Cloneable
    This interface represents nodes or vertices in a graph.

    Members of this class must be cloneable in order to implement graph duplication.

    Author:
    Javier Marrero

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean addEdge​(Edge edge)
      Creates a new connection given an edge.
      java.lang.Object clone()
      void disconnect()
      Disconnects this node, clearing all the edges incoming or outgoing.
      T get()
      Returns the data this node holds.
      Edge getAdjacentEdge​(Node<T> v)
      Returns the edge connecting this node and v.
      java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> getAllAdjacentVertices()
      Returns a Collection containing all the adjacent vertices to this node.
      java.util.Set<Edge> getEdgesArrivingSelf()
      Returns the set of edges that have this node as the destination node.
      java.util.Set<Edge> getEdgesDepartingSelf()
      Returns the set of edges connected to this node.
      int getLabel()
      Nodes inserted within a graph get access to a label that uniquely identifies them within a graph.
      boolean isAdjacent​(Node<T> v)
      Returns true if this node is adjacent to another node in a graph.
      boolean removeEdge​(Edge edge)
      Removes an edge from this node's adjacent edges.
      void set​(T data)
      Sets this node's data attribute.

        Creates a new connection given an edge.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        void disconnect()
        Disconnects this node, clearing all the edges incoming or outgoing.

      • get

        T get()
        Returns the data this node holds.
        Returns:
        a reference to the data that holds this node.

      • getLabel

        int getLabel()
        Nodes inserted within a graph get access to a label that uniquely identifies them within a graph. This could be their index in the adjacency matrix or their index within the adjacency list.

        It is not correct to assume that this number is any of the things described above, but it can be used to uniquely identify the node within the graph, such as no other node will have the same label. Label allocation is responsibility of the Graph class.

        Returns:
        the integer label of this node

      • getAdjacentEdge

        Edge getAdjacentEdge​(Node<T> v)
        Returns the edge connecting this node and v.
        Parameters:
        v -
        Returns:
        the Edge connecting this node and v, or null.

      • getAllAdjacentVertices

        java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> getAllAdjacentVertices()
        Returns a Collection containing all the adjacent vertices to this node.
        Returns:

      • getEdgesDepartingSelf

        java.util.Set<Edge> getEdgesDepartingSelf()
        Returns the set of edges connected to this node. If the node is isolated, it should return the empty set. This set is an unmodifiable view of the Node's internal container.
        Returns:
        the set of connected edges.

      • getEdgesArrivingSelf

        java.util.Set<Edge> getEdgesArrivingSelf()
        Returns the set of edges that have this node as the destination node. If the node is isolated should return the empty set. The set is an unmodifiable view of the Node's internal container.
        Returns:
